org.zaproxy.zap.extension.websocket

Class WebSocketListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.zaproxy.zap.extension.websocket.WebSocketListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable

    public class WebSocketListener
extends Object
implements Runnable
    Wrap it in a thread to listen for one end of a WebSockets connection. It does so by using blocking reads and passes read bytes to WebSocketProxy for processing. If you want to listen (a.k.a. observe) for WebSocket messages, see the WebSocketObserver class.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WebSocketListener(WebSocketProxy wsProxy, InputStream in, OutputStream out, String name)
      Create listener, that calls the WebSocketsProxy instance to process read data.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      OutputStream getOutputStream()
      Use this stream to send custom messages.
      boolean isFinished()
      Has this listener already stopped working?
      void run()
      Start listening and process messages as long as the Socket is open.
      void stop()
      Interrupts current thread, stopping its execution.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • WebSocketListener

        public WebSocketListener(WebSocketProxy wsProxy,
                 InputStream in,
                 OutputStream out,
                 String name)
        Create listener, that calls the WebSocketsProxy instance to process read data. It contains also the other end's writer to forward frames.
        Parameters:
        wsProxy - When a read has to be processed, it delegates it to this object.
        in - Read from one side.
        out - Write to the other side.
        name - Name of this thread (used for logging too).

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Start listening and process messages as long as the Socket is open.
        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Interrupts current thread, stopping its execution.

      • isFinished

        public boolean isFinished()
        Has this listener already stopped working?
        Returns:
        True if listener stopped listening.

      • getOutputStream

        public OutputStream getOutputStream()
        Use this stream to send custom messages.
        Returns:
        outgoing stream
